page.title: 12ST. MARGARET'S CHURCH
page.content: St. Margaret's Church is situated next to the primary school in Quadring. These two are by what is thought to be the original main road which is one kilometre away from the main body of the village. The building is light and airy. A very good view of the surrounding area can be had from the church tower. There is an account in ancient Lincoln Diocesan Records of the Induction of a Vicar to Quadring in 1250. Earlier still,Walter De Rochford in 1200 was compelled to pay tribute to the Abbess of Stainfield from the revenue of Quadring Church. Mention is made in the original Domesday Book that a large part of Quadring belonged to the Bishop of Lincoln,and His Lordship would be under an obligation to provide for the spiritual needs of the people. i.e. a church.
